title: cafter
author: cafter
created_time: April 08, 2023, 10:02:08 AMLast edit: April 11, 2023, 08:58:33 AM by cafter
content: On this forum we can see lot of information about users and more on this website  : https://bpip.orgmy question is: is there any other way available to check total volume on this forum? we can see total search volume by tools like semrush, ahref, etc. but many people bookmarked this url and some type directly into browser so we can see exactly how many people come here ?not very important to find these but just for curiosity, and know more about this forum.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: What do you mean by the total volume? The number of people visiting the site each month? SEMRush (which you mentioned) should show you that. See the traffic analysis page[1]. Or alternatively, you also have the forum's stats page[2] (if you're looking to know how many registered users are online)[1] https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bitcointalk.org&searchType=domain[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=stats

comments.author: cafter
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on April 08, 2023, 10:14:30 AMWhat do you mean by the total volume? The number of people visiting the site each month? SEMRush (which you mentioned) should show you that. See the traffic analysis page[1]. Or alternatively, you also have the forum's stats page[2] (if you're looking to know how many registered users are online)[1] https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bitcointalk.org&searchType=domain[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=statssemrush shows traffic from socialmedia and search engines, they not show us when we visit by typing url or clicking bookmark.SEMrush is a comprehensive tool for monitoring and analyzing website traffic, with a particular emphasis on traffic from search engines.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Check similarweb- https://www.similarweb.com/website/bitcointalk.org/#traffic-sourcesYou will be able to find visitors based on specific keywords. In this case, people visit bitcointalk with the exact keyword- ~18700 per monthPeople also visit bitcoin talk, crypto casino, etc, and visit the forum. Not sure if you are looking for these stats, you will find a lot of other amazing data there including per month page views, referring site stats, visitors stats from social media etc.

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on April 08, 2023, 10:14:30 AMWhat do you mean by the total volume? The number of people visiting the site each month? SEMRush (which you mentioned) should show you that. See the traffic analysis page[1]. Or alternatively, you also have the forum's stats page[2] (if you're looking to know how many registered users are online)[1] https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bitcointalk.org&searchType=domain[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=statsTo add to the previous links shared by OmegaStarScream I suppose you can always also check here[1] for advertisement stats within the forum. Albeit at the moment there's no campaign running, the data keeps being updated and also sheds some light on the traffic that comes to the forum in a way.[1]https://bitcointalk.org/adrotate.php?adstats

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: RickDeckard on April 08, 2023, 11:22:34 AMTo add to the previous links shared by OmegaStarScream I suppose you can always also check here[1] for advertisement stats within the forum. Albeit at the moment there's no campaign running, the data keeps being updated and also sheds some light on the traffic that comes to the forum in a way.[1]https://bitcointalk.org/adrotate.php?adstatsAbout 2 years ago, I made a chart for 2020 year-end report and one of charts is for forum ads stats.After Round 353, ends in late September 2022, theymos suspend forum ad sales

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on April 08, 2023, 10:22:41 AMsemrush shows traffic from socialmedia and search engines, they not show us when we visit by typing url or clicking bookmark.-snip-They actually do, if you check the "traffic journey" tab. You just need to get a free trial account first but make sure you can cancel it before doing it so they don't charge you.Quote from: https://www.semrush.com/kb/1061-traffic-analytics-traffic-journeyDirect — traffic to a domain via URLs entered in a browser’s search bar, saved bookmarks or links from outside a browser (such as PDFs or Microsoft Word documents).

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Only the adstat page (linked already above and here[2]) is the existing built-in traffic analytics this forum uses, that's what i knew. Semrush and similarweb are tools that are just estimate and is too far from the actual stat recorded in built-in traffic analytics.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/adrotate.php?adstats

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on April 08, 2023, 10:02:08 AMmy question is: is there any other way available to check total volume on this forum? we can see total search volume by tools like semrush, ahref, etc. but many people bookmarked this url and some type directly into browser so we can see exactly how many people come here.All the data you find, via the various sources referenced by users who responded to this topic, will always be estimated. For most cases and to quench your curiosity, it should do.More precise data, only site administrators with access to the server can know.

comments.author: cafter
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on April 08, 2023, 05:42:43 PMQuote from: cafter on April 08, 2023, 10:02:08 AMmy question is: is there any other way available to check total volume on this forum? we can see total search volume by tools like semrush, ahref, etc. but many people bookmarked this url and some type directly into browser so we can see exactly how many people come here.All the data you find, via the various sources referenced by users who responded to this topic, will always be estimated. For most cases and to quench your curiosity, it should do.More precise data, only site administrators with access to the server can know.yes, like some site have "users online : xx" like this no?these all are estimates to analyze trends , traffic, backlinks, etc for seo and basic purposes and other analytics purpose

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on April 08, 2023, 06:16:31 PMyes, like some site have "users online : xx" like this no?This function was disabled about 10 years ago, so at this point we have no way of knowing this precisely.Basically all the standard SMF statistics were disabled, probably to be able to guarantee the best overall performance, avoiding the accumulation of unnecessary information in the database.

comments.author: Halab
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on April 08, 2023, 09:11:30 PMQuote from: cafter on April 08, 2023, 06:16:31 PMyes, like some site have "users online : xx" like this no?This function was disabled about 10 years ago, so at this point we have no way of knowing this precisely.In fact this information is available here: https://bitcointalk.org/SSI.php?ssi_function=whosOnlineAnd I'm surprised that this page is not exploited by our crazy coders to make nice stats and graphs .

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: Halab on April 09, 2023, 08:05:26 AMIn fact this information is available here: https://bitcointalk.org/SSI.php?ssi_function=whosOnlineAnd I'm surprised that this page is not exploited by our crazy coders to make nice stats and graphs .Didn't know! Thanks for the info!I believe that many, like me, are unaware. Or maybe I was just too distracted. It is a page that I will keep and maybe I can have some idea of how to work with this information.

comments.author: karmamiu
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on April 09, 2023, 08:10:50 AMQuote from: Halab on April 09, 2023, 08:05:26 AMIn fact this information is available here: https://bitcointalk.org/SSI.php?ssi_function=whosOnlineAnd I'm surprised that this page is not exploited by our crazy coders to make nice stats and graphs .Didn't know! Thanks for the info!I believe that many, like me, are unaware. Or maybe I was just too distracted. It is a page that I will keep and maybe I can have some idea of how to work with this information. Didn't know this existed actually. For sure that whoever sees this and also a programmer would make this much easier to view. I can see that during this time only a few people are online. Well, it's understandable since we have different time zones. It's good to know you can see who's online or not, gonna bookmark this one for future usage.

Well, it's understandable since we have different time zones. It's good to know you can see who's online or not, gonna bookmark this one for future usage.heres one more site like this, i found yesterday check out here : https://ninjastic.space/you can see here : posts per day, posts per month, merits sent and received in a day, how many posts posted 24hr, you can search post by post number, you see stats of a particular user, etc.and bpip i think everyone knows, who don't : bpip.org    , here also too much interesting info available about bitcointalk.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on April 11, 2023, 08:23:39 AMheres one more site like this, i found yesterday check out here : https://ninjastic.space/you can see here : posts per day, posts per month, merits sent and received in a day, how many posts posted 24hr, you can search post by post number, you see stats of a particular user, etc.and bpip i think everyone knows, who don't : bpip.org    , here also too much interesting info available about bitcointalk.Many forum members know about bpip and even the website you found. This is the thread created by the person who build that site from scratch. There are lots of information you can find using that site like post per day, post per month, edited posts (except when a post is edited within 10 minutes if I remember it correctly right after when it is posted) and also you can check deleted posts too. After the time is up then the posts that will edited will be seen in there and the original content before it was edited. Take this post as an example, when I posted this and edited within the timeframe then it won't show in ninjastic and after the time is up and I edited the post again then you can check the original content as I have explained it in this post.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: nakamura12 on April 11, 2023, 09:35:06 AMMany forum members know about bpip and even the website you found. This is the thread created by the person who build that site from scratch. Forgot to mention the link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5273824.0  The site ninjastic.space is one of the most used by users of the forum to obtain statistics, in addition to bpip.org of course.

Forgot to mention the link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5273824.0  The site ninjastic.space is one of the most used by users of the forum to obtain statistics, in addition to bpip.org of course.What about the DdmrDdmr Merit Dashboard Why this will be left out , let me do the list of four giant tools in together. Bitcointalk Merit Dashboard by DdmrDdmrhttps://loyce.club/  by LoyceV  see the LOYCE.CLUB'S user pagehttps://ninjastic.space/ by TryNinjahttps://bpip.org/To the OP(cafter), if you want to analyze the forum or analyze the users of the forum, then these four tools will help you a lot. And for this, these four tools are presented to you together. If you want, you can take notes on google keep, these four tools are common and the best tools for browsing forum data
